intro: Silene quadridentata subsp. malyi, commonly known as the Malyi campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations. The plant produces pink to purple flowers with four petals, which are arranged in a radial symmetry. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its adaptability to harsh environments. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and floral morphology.
